documents.title: Introduction
documents.summary: mitmproxy is an intercepting proxy tool for HTTP/1, HTTP/2, and WebSockets with multiple interfaces including console, web-based, and command-line versions.

documents.title: Getting Started
documents.summary: This guide explains how to install and configure mitmproxy tools to intercept and inspect web traffic, including setting up a browser proxy and installing the certificate authority.

documents.title: Installation
documents.summary: This document provides detailed installation instructions for mitmproxy across different operating systems, including macOS, Linux, and Windows, along with advanced installation methods.

documents.title: User Interface
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive navigation guide for mitmproxy documentation, including installation, tutorials, core concepts, addon development, API reference, and how-to guides.

documents.title: Features
documents.summary: This guide explains various mitmproxy features for modifying HTTP requests and responses, including features that allow controlling cache behavior, blocking specific requests, redirecting to local files, replacing URLs, and modifying message bodies.

documents.title: Modify Requests
documents.summary: This tutorial demonstrates how to modify intercepted HTTP requests in mitmproxy before forwarding them to their destination.

documents.title: Replay Requests
documents.summary: This tutorial explains how to replay previous client requests using mitmproxy's client-side replay functionality.

documents.title: How mitmproxy works
documents.summary: This document explains mitmproxy's proxy mechanism in detail, covering explicit HTTP and HTTPS proxying, TLS interception techniques, and the challenges of transparent proxying.

documents.title: User Interface
documents.summary: This tutorial introduces the mitmproxy user interface, covering the default flow list view, navigation using arrow keys, viewing flow details with ENTER, switching between panes, and executing commands directly through the command prompt.

documents.title: Options
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure mitmproxy using YAML configuration files, command-line options, and interactive editors, covering all available runtime options and their defaults.

documents.title: Custom Options
documents.summary: This document teaches mitmproxy addon developers how to declare, configure, and handle custom options for their addons.

documents.title: Intercept Traffic
documents.summary: Tutorial showing how to intercept and monitor network traffic in various applications and environments

documents.title: Replay Flows
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive navigation guide to mitmproxy documentation covering installation, tutorials for web UI and CLI, core concepts, addon development, API reference, and practical how-to guides.

documents.title: mitmproxy.http
documents.summary: This document defines the Headers class and MessageData dataclass used for representing HTTP messages in mitmproxy, including header management and serialization functionality.

documents.title: mitmproxy.flow
documents.summary: Defines base classes for network flow objects in mitmproxy, including the Flow base class and Error class with serialization, replay, and backup functionality.

documents.title: Custom Commands
documents.summary: This document explains how to create and use custom commands in mitmproxy addons, including defining commands with decorators, specifying argument types, and working with flow selectors.

documents.title: Transparent Proxying
documents.summary: Guide explaining how to implement transparent proxying for network traffic routing

documents.title: Setting highscores on Apple GameCenter
documents.summary: This tutorial demonstrates how to use mitmproxy to intercept and modify Apple Game Center score submissions by configuring a proxy and editing request data.

documents.title: Certificates
documents.summary: Collection of digital and printed certificates documenting professional achievements and qualifications

documents.title: System CA on Android Emulator
documents.summary: This guide explains how to install the mitmproxy CA certificate into the Android emulator's system certificate store to enable SSL inspection on applications that ignore user-provided certificates.

documents.title: mitmproxy.proxy.context
documents.summary: This document defines the Context class for the mitmproxy proxy core, which provides access to client connections, server connections, options, and protocol layer stacks for each protocol layer.

documents.title: mitmproxy.contentviews
documents.summary: This document provides the Contentview API for formatting, decoding, highlighting, and reencoding data in mitmproxy, including custom contentview registration and syntax highlighting support.

documents.title: Custom Contentviews
documents.summary: This guide explains how to create custom content views in mitmproxy for pretty-printing binary message data and implementing interactive content editing capabilities.

documents.title: mitmproxy.net.server_spec
documents.summary: Provides a ServerSpec type and parse function for parsing server mode specifications like http://example.com or example.org:443.

documents.title: What's Next
documents.summary: Explores future trends and directions, offering insights into upcoming developments and strategic planning.

documents.title: Intercept Requests
documents.summary: Tutorial demonstrating how to intercept and modify HTTP requests using browser developer tools and programming techniques.

documents.title: mitmproxy.tcp
documents.summary: mitmproxy's TCP interception module for monitoring and modifying TCP traffic

documents.title: mitmproxy.coretypes.multidict
documents.summary: This document defines an abstract base class and concrete implementations for a MultiDict data structure that supports multiple values per key, commonly used for HTTP headers.

documents.title: mitmproxy.proxy.server_hooks
documents.summary: Defines event hooks for tracking client and server connection states in mitmproxy proxy server.

documents.title: Proxy Modes
documents.summary: This guide explains how to configure mitmproxy's different proxy modes including regular proxy, local capture, WireGuard, reverse proxy, and advanced modes.

documents.title: Ignoring Domains
documents.summary: This guide explains how to configure the ignore_hosts option in mitmproxy to exempt specific domains from interception, covering its use for certificate pinning and traffic filtering.

documents.title: mitmproxy.certs
documents.summary: This document defines a certificate class for handling TLS certificates in the mitmproxy tool, providing methods for parsing, validating, and serializing X.509 certificates.

documents.title: Overview
documents.summary: This document explains mitmproxy's addon mechanism and how to create custom addons using events, options, and commands.

documents.title: Event Hooks
documents.summary: This document explains the available event hooks in mitmproxy addons, detailing how to hook into internal mechanisms and manage various network flows.

documents.title: mitmproxy.websocket
documents.summary: Library for handling WebSocket traffic through mitmproxy, enabling inspection and manipulation of WebSocket connections

documents.title: mitmproxy.connection
documents.summary: Provides core connection classes and utilities for intercepting and inspecting network traffic in mitmproxy, including client and server connection handling, TLS analysis, and tunneling support.

documents.title: Analyze Flows
documents.summary: Comprehensive documentation portal covering mitmproxy installation, tutorials, core concepts, addon development, API reference, and HOWTO guides for network interception and manipulation.

documents.title: mitmproxy.tls
documents.summary: This document defines a ClientHello class for parsing TLS and DTLS ClientHello messages, along with data classes for TLS-related event hooks in mitmproxy.

documents.title: Modify Requests
documents.summary: Instructions for modifying HTTP requests, including parameters, headers, and data manipulation.

documents.title: mitmproxy.udp
documents.summary: This document defines UDPFlow and UDPMessage classes for representing UDP sessions and datagrams in mitmproxy.

documents.title: mitmproxy.addonmanager
documents.summary: This document defines the addon management system for mitmproxy, including classes and functions for loading, registering, and managing addons within the proxy framework.

documents.title: API Changelog
documents.summary: This document outlines breaking changes in the mitmproxy addon API across different versions, including deprecated logging systems, renamed classes, and modified connection event hooks.

documents.title: Examples
documents.summary: This document provides example scripts and implementations for creating mitmproxy addons, demonstrating various capabilities like HTTP manipulation, command handling, flow processing, and more.

documents.title: mitmproxy.proxy.mode_specs
documents.summary: This module defines and parses proxy mode specifications for mitmproxy, supporting modes like regular, reverse, and socks5 with configurable listen addresses and ports.

documents.title: Filter expressions
documents.summary: A technical guide explaining filter expressions for data processing and conditional logic implementation

documents.title: Transparently Proxying VMs
documents.summary: This guide explains how to configure transparent proxying with mitmproxy by setting up a proxy virtual machine, configuring DHCP and DNS with dnsmasq, redirecting traffic using iptables, and running mitmproxy in transparent mode.

documents.title: mitmproxy.dns
documents.summary: Defines data classes and utility functions for DNS resource record parsing, serialization, and creation in the mitmproxy project.

documents.title: /howto/transparent/
documents.summary: This document is empty and contains no content for metadata extraction.

documents.title: Client playback: a 30 second example
documents.summary: This tutorial demonstrates how to use mitmproxy's client replay feature to automate wireless network logins by recording and replaying login requests.

documents.title: Wireshark and SSL/TLS
documents.summary: A comprehensive guide to using Wireshark for capturing and analyzing SSL/TLS encrypted network traffic, including methods for decrypting HTTPS communications through certificate configuration and man-in-the-middle techniques.

documents.title: Commands
documents.summary: Commands for a text editor

documents.title: Protocols
documents.summary: Protocols section explains established procedures and guidelines for system operations and communication standards.
